script: Chief, we got unarmed civilians getting shot down here at 9:00.
I don't think we can touch this.
This food is the property of Mohamed Farrah Aidid!
Command Super 6-4, we got militia shooting unarmed civilians...
down at the food distribution center.
Miami, my friend, is not Cuba.
I see not catching Aidid is becoming a routine.
We weren't trying to catch Aidid.
Me? But am I that important?
You've been here, what, six weeks?
Six weeks you are trying to catch the general.
What is this, gunfight at the K.O. Corral?
It's, uh-- It's the O.K. Corral.
Do you think bringing me in would make him suddenly come to you?
You pay for his beds, much less his militia.
We're not leaving Somalia until we find him.
of thinking because I grew up without running water, I am simple, General.
I do know something about history.
A tomorrow without a lot of Arkansas white boys' ideas in it.
Well, I wouldn't know about that.
Mr. Garrison, I think you shouldn't have come here.
This is our war, not yours.
Three hundred thousand dead and counting.
That's not a war, Mr. Atto.
Now, you enjoy that tea, you hear?
It'll take some time, but Aidid will feel the loss.
I'm not sure time is something we got in great supply.
Boss, most of Washington might disagree.
They've been calling for these dang situation reports every morning this week.
Well, tell them the situation is, uh, fragile.
Ladies and gentlemen, my name is Cliff Elvis Wolcott.
I'll be your pilot this afternoon.
Federal regulations has designated it the nonsmoking Black Hawk helicopter.
For those of you enrolled in our Mogadishu frequent flyer program, you'll be earning 100 free credits this afternoon.
And as always, the air sickness bags are located...
in the seatback in front of you.
Number one indications are good, Cliff. Put her on two.
I don't wanna hear about it.
Limo is a word in common usage.
That is the key phrase in Scrabble, my good friend.
No. If it's not in the dictionary, it doesn't count.
It does have to be in the dictionary.
You touch my limo and I'll spank you, Nightstalker.
That's a nice beach down there.
Firstly, it's the Mog, or simply Mog.
No one calls it Mogadishu here.
Secondly, I wouldn't know about the fighting, so don't ask.
Look, kid, you look like you're about 12, so let me explain something to you.
I have a rare and mysterious skill that precludes me from going on the missions.
Well, I'm here to kick some ass.
Single shot through the engine block.
He should be around here somewhere.
Well, this isn't the back of it.
Delta or no Delta, that's a hot weapon.
Well, this is my safety, sir.
You Delta boys are a bunch of undisciplined cowboys.
Let me tell you something, Sergeant.
When we get on the five-yard line, you're gonna need my Rangers.
So y'all better learn to be team players.
Speak up. You say this is your safety?
Well, this is my boot, son.
And it will fit up your ass with the proper amount of force.
If Delta wants to wear Oakleys, that's their business.
I don't wanna see 'em on you again. Hoo-ah.
I can mate you in three whatever you do.
I'd keep my eye on that queen before counseling with others.
Well, she's just lying in wait.
They are not supposed to scare the living shit out of the children.
This is the part of the story where our knight, our warrior, is about to slay the one-eyed dragon.
- I thought you finished that last week.
We are at the ten-yard line here, men. You understand?
Hey, I didn't see you in church on Sunday, soldier.
You had something more important to do?
I will make you believe, you understand?
You understand why we have a chain of command, don't you?
'Cause if I ever see you undermining it again, you'll be cleaning latrines with your tongue until you can't taste the difference...
If one skinny kills another skinny, his clan owes the dead guy's clan a hundred camels.
Must be a lot a fucking camel debt.
It's not that I like 'em or I don't like 'em.
See, what you guys fail to realize...
is the sergeant here is a bit of an idealist.
He believes in this mission down to his very bones.
Look, these people, they have no jobs, no food, no education, no future.
I just figure that-- I mean, we have two things that we can do.
We can either help or we can sit back and watch the country destroy itself on CNN.
I don't know about you guys, but I was trained to fight.
Well, I think I was trained to make a difference, Kurth.
Like the man said, he's an idealist.
Wait. This is my favorite part.
Well, he'll be fine, but not in this army.
I'm putting you in charge of his chalk.
You got a problem with that?
Your men are gonna look to you to make the right decisions.
The long anticipated meeting of Aidid's senior cabinet...
may take place today at 1500 hours.
I say may because we all know by now, with the intel we get on the street, nothing is certain.
This is actual intel confirmed by three sources.
Two tier-one personalities may be present: Omar Salad, Aidid's top political advisor, and Abdi Hassan Awale, Interior Minister.
These are the guys we're after.
Security Force Rangers: four Ranger chalks, under the command of Cpt. Steele, will rope in at 1546 and hold a four-corner perimeter...
No one gets in or out.
Extraction Force: Lieutenant Colonel McKnight's humvee column...
will drive into the city at 1547 on Hawlwadig Road...
and hold just short of the Olympic Hotel.
Now, once Delta gives the word, the next column will move to the target building...
and load the prisoners on flatbed trucks.
Immediately after the prisoners are loaded, the four Ranger chalks...
will collapse back to the target building, load up on humvees...
and the entire ground force will exfil the three miles back to base.
Mission time from incursion to extraction no longer than 30 minutes.
Now, I had requested light armor and AC-130 Specter gunships, but Washington, in all its wisdom, decided against this.
So Black Hawks and Little Birds will provide the air cover...
In the C-2 bird, Colonel Matthews will coordinate the air mission...
and I will coordinate ground forces.
Mission launch code word is Irene.
I don't choose the time or place of their meetings.
I didn't say a word, sir.
Once you're in the Bakara market, you're in an entirely hostile district.
We'll be going through friendly neighborhoods before we hit the market.
So remember the rules of engagement: No one fires unless fired upon.
Let's go get this thing done.
No Specter gunships, daylight instead of night, late afternoon when they're all fucked up on khat, only part of the city Aidid can mount a serious counterattack on short notice.
Down in the street, it's unforgiving.
Why should I tell you that?
Ev, it's gonna be nothing, man.
It's all in the grind, Sizemore.
This, my friend, is a science.
I mean, you're looking at the guy that believed the commercials.
I made coffee through Desert Storm.
I made coffee through Panama while everyone else got to fight, got to be a Ranger.
Now it's Grimesy, black, one sugar...
or Grimesy, got a powdered anywhere?
You're taking my place assisting the 60 gunner.
Sergeant Eversmann said to get your stuff and get ready.
It's what you wanted, isn't it?
and give him ammo when he needs it. Hoo-ah?
Generally speaking, Somalis can't shoot for shit.
Just watch out for the sammys throwing the fucking rocks, and you'll be fine.
All we got to do is cover them.
Choppers gonna cover us, and we'll be all right.
Look, you guys, I know this is my first time as chalk leader, but this isn't our first time out together.
We're Rangers, not some sorry-ass J.R.O.T.C.
You're not gonna need that, dude.
We're not out there long enough.
You're not gonna need that either.
- You might as well take dope and beer instead.
Let me tell you something, Grimes.
You got about 50 pounds of gear as it is.
I don't know about you, but I'm not planning on getting shot in the back running away.
Well, I better keep mine in.
The most important thing: just remember when everybody else is shooting, shoot in the same direction.
It's a good thing you're right-handed, Adonis.
If not, I don't know what you'd do.
I'm not taking no death letter.
I'll give it to you back in an hour.
I've been training my whole life for this.
You ever shot at anybody before?
Tell him to turn his damn radio off.
-Tell him to turn his radio off.
Hi. You've reached Stephanie and Randy.
I'm just calling to check up on you, make sure everything's all right.
I'll call you in a couple of hours.
You know, it's kind of funny.
Could almost be a good place to visit.
You don't think we should be here?
It don't really matter what I think.
Once that first bullet goes past your head, politics and all that shit just goes right out the window.
I just wanna do it right today.
Get all your men back here alive.
Now, is this supposed to be the place...
or did his car just take a dump?
To my right-hand side, above the cafe.
Sir, he says this is the building.
Abdi, you need to be sure.
Well, it's down the road, two blocks over...
If I go closer, they might shoot me.
Now he's saying the building's actually a couple blocks down.
But if he's seen outside it, he'll be shot.
I'll fuckin' shoot him myself a couple blocks down.
Tell him I want his skinny ass parked in front of the damn building.
He's not getting paid until he does exactly that.
It's three miles to the target area.
At the K-4 traffic circle, we turn north, then east on National, and we wait until extraction of prisoners is complete here.
Then we roll up in force on Hawlwadig.
and then the assault and blocking forces, and bring 'em back.
But be careful what you shoot at because people do live there.
Last one of these guys shot himself in the head playing Russian roulette in a bar.
So this is the real deal now.
Good. That's always a good sign.
Nothing. He's just never done that before.
Signals to the militia that we're coming.
5-6, it looks like there's some friendlies on the ground.
It look like I've got intel on the voice intercept.
But I've got burning tires in the front of us. Over.
Last rope I almost bit my tongue off.
Little Birds touching down at target.
take up an overhead pattern to provide sniper cover.
C-2, we got a man fallen.
Super 6-1, you're a sitting duck there.
I need you to move to the north of the street.
Schmid, we got a man hit.
We're not being shot at yet.
- A snap means-- Now they're shooting at us.
Take a breath, 2-5, and calm down. Over.
Matt, it's a long way to the humvees.
We'll get a stretcher in here.
Super 6-1, we got a man wounded on the ground.
Providing sniper cover for prisoner extract.
Romeo 6-4, I need to send out three humvees with a critical casualty.
- We'll chop a team of gunships to you. Over.
Hey, Sanderson, I need extra security on these humvees.
I'll go. I'll take my team, make sure they get back okay.
Do it. Struecker, you're lead humvee.
I don't wanna talk about it now, Colonel.
We have a K.I.A., Dominick Pilla. Over.
Three guys with R.P.G.'s coming up on your side now!
You wanna pull those P.C.L.'s off-line or what?
We got a Black Hawk down.
Super 6-1 is on the deck now.
I want ground forces to move and secure a new perimeter around that crash site.
Can you guide the convoy in there?
The whole damn city will be coming down on top of them.
Star 4-1, come inbound and see if you can land at the crash site.
2-5, Chalk Four is closest to the crash site. Over.
6-4, I can't see the crash site. Over.
Leave a security element in place.
Take the rest of your chalk on foot to the crash.
Hey, there's a Black Hawk down.
Twombly, Nelson, you're gonna stay here.
and then exfil with the humvees.
Galentine, Schmid, you're coming with me.
Juliet 2-5, hostiles advancing parallel west to your position.
Be advised, women and children among them. Over.
You take the rest of the team.
You'll proceed to the crash site together.
Secure the perimeter, wait for the humvees.
All right, we need to move out now!
and pick you up at the crash site.
Get in! Get in the truck!
Hey, Grimes, stay away from the walls.
Maddox, look at these jerks, these idiots!
We got skinnies movin' in from all directions.
We need to get them help now.
Indigenous personnel advancing to Wolcott crash site.
How far is Chalk Four from the crash site?
Romeo 6-4, I need to know before I get to the goddamn street!
from the time directions are relayed...
from surveillance to J.O.C., then to me.
Danny, I'm getting information from Orion surveillance above.
So get me my fucking directions to the crash site!
Hold on. I no longer have the best view of your route.
Then get your ass in the right place, goddamn it!
What in the hell is the status of Struecker's humvees?
Colonel Harrell, E.T.A. to base, Struecker's column.
Star 4-1 is at the crash site to evacuate the injured.
We're setting up a perimeter. Over.
Captain Steele, Captain Steele, come in.
We got two wounded and we got both the pilots dead in the chopper.
We need a medivac over here now!
2-5, they're telling me it's too hot to land the bird.
You got to secure the perimeter first. Over.
They're encountering a lot of resistance. 6-4 out.
You should see the crash directly ahead.
All I see is a roadblock!
All right. I'll have to figure out another way.
Give me a defensive perimeter so we can load the wounded.
Tell my girls I'll be okay.
Come on, help me pick him up!
Get us off this fucking street!
Let's go! Let's go, goddamn it! Let's go!
The humvees ain't coming back, dude.
Were we supposed to go to them?
I thought they were supposed to come to us.
Shit. Shit, I think we're supposed to go to them.
Let's go to the crash site.
Just don't fire that thing so close to my head.
I swear to God, you do that again-- - You okay?
Search and rescue bird on station, inserting medics.
Super 6-8, there is smoke coming from the top of your rotor.
- Advise you to come out now.
Art, I've got skinnies with R.P.G.'s at 12:00.
Hey, Wilkie, what's the situation in there?
2-5, we can't move these guys, Matty.
We'll kill them just carrying them.
Super 6-4, come inbound and take Wolcott's position.
You sure? You look like you got clipped pretty good.
Got a slight vibration in the pedals, but we're good.
All right, put her down on the airfield, Super 6-4.
I'm getting a lot of movement in these pedals.
Get Struecker's column back out there.
They need to get to Durant's crash site fast.
Captain Steele, we gotta move or we're gonna get pinned down!
We're moving just as fast as we can.
You let me do my job and you do yours. Over.
Fuck this! Captain Steele, I'll take out the threat in the window.
We'll rally point at the gray building.
Let's go, let's go, let's go!
Come on, come on, come on, come on!
What the fuck are you doing out there?
We got to get out on that street, and we got to move!
You have got to keep up, sir!
Don't you ever give me orders, Sergeant.
Then give me some of your shooters, and I'll circle us to the bird.
The rest of you men secure this position, treat the wounded.
We'll wait for the convoy, then we'll rally at the crash site. Roger!
C-2, I have two Delta snipers, Shughart and Gordon, volunteering to secure crash site two. Over.
We don't see anything moving down there now.
We don't even know if anyone's alive.
A ground team is being organized to go in now.
Do what you can from the air.
We're going back in to get him.
Is there anyone alive on that?
Refit and max out ammo and grenades.
Sizemore, where the hell you think you're going?
Not with that cast on, you're not.
All right, all right, all right.
Thomas, everyone feels the same way you do, all right?
It's what you do right now that makes a difference.
It'll probably help to wash the blood out of the humvees.
You wanna know why? You said, You're not gonna need that.
I wasn't saying it to you.
It's my fault. I-- We need to get out of here.
We need a position of the convoy. Over.
Sir, let's get the fuck out of here and evac!
Ground forces have occupied several buildings along Marehan Road, but they're all spread out.
Eversmann's Chalk Four has set up a perimeter around Wolcott's crash site here.
DiTomasso is in the adjacent structure.
Captain Steele and about 40 men, Rangers, are here.
He set up a casualty collection point.
I don't think they're gonna be able to move.
Sergeant Sanderson and a small Delta team...
are moving from Steele's position to the crash site as we speak.
There's a crowd advancing six, seven blocks from the crash.
Shughart and Gordon again request permission to secure until convoy arrives.
From where they are, they can see things clearer than any of us.
I want to make sure that y'all understand what you're asking for, so say it out loud and clear.
We're asking to go in and set up a perimeter until ground support arrives.
And you realize that I cannot tell you when that might be.
- It could take quite a while.
- And you still want to go in there?
There's a fucking rocket in him, sir!
Get in that truck and drive.
Surveillance says to take Hawlwadig, then go straight.
McKnight, we need you to turn around and head back to Hawlwadig.
There's gotta be a better route!
That's the info I'm getting from J.O.C.
You need to turn around and head back.
- They're trying to get us all fucking killed!
Keep your foot on the gas!
Keep your foot on the-- Fuck!
C-2, Shughart and Gordon are on the deck. Over.
and my back feels kind of weird.
We've got to get you out of here, buddy.
C-2, we're at the 6-4 crash site, securing perimeter.
Any skinnies come around these corners, - you watch our backs.
All right, stop, stop, stop, stop. Maddox, stop.
Son of a bitch. Romeo 6-4, we're back where we started.
I'm running low on ammo, I got many wounded, including me, vehicles that are barely running.
Okay, Danny, I need a no B.S.
Can you get to the crash site?
With the amount of wounded we have, we'd do more harm than good.
We need to come back to base, rearm and regroup, and then we can go back out.
The convoy's headed back to base camp.
and get out of here before it's too late!
If Colonel McKnight went back to base, then he had a good reason.
We're gonna hold the perimeter, and we're gonna hold the strongpoint. Hoo-ah?
Randy, I need a pistol mag!
We need the 10th Mountain in there. Everything they got.
They still don't know we've gone in.
Look, we have stirred up the hornet's nest here.
I want every vehicle possible that's got four wheels and armor. Get it.
Once they've assembled, we're gonna move our men out of the hostile area and back to the Pakistani stadium.
Stay with me. You just got a bullet in the leg.
Roger. I can see it, but I can't get there.
Request permission to move to crash site number two on foot. Over.
After I'm finished with this, I'll whip you boys up some margaritas.
Sanderson. Do not-- I say again, do not fire to the east.
DiTomasso and his men are on the southeast corner.
We need you on the northeast building.
They're in prayer, but not for much longer.
Hold your fire to the east.
I got Nelson and Twombly with me.
- We got the chopper in sight.
When he gets across the street, he's gonna turn around and cover you as you run.
When you get there, you're gonna turn around and you're gonna cover me, okay?
You're not just gonna run to Eversmann's position.
You're gonna stop, you're gonna turn around, and you are going to cover me.
Doc! Gimme some help with Smith here!
Come on, Jamie, I got you!
Oh, man, that really-- - I need that chair.
They're not gonna come and get us.
They're not gonna come for us.
I need you to suck it up, Sergeant.
Anybody comes through that door, you give him two in the chest and one in the head.
Cpt. Steele! Cpt. Steele, I need a medivac in here now!
You're just gonna have to maintain your situation. Over.
If he doesn't get to a hospital in a half hour, he's in trouble.
for a critically wounded at Chalk Four's location. Over.
Command, Chalk Four is requesting medivac.
Captain, we cannot send in medivac at this time.
You're just gonna have to hold on.
I want direct pressure on the wound.
Lieutenant Colonel Cribbs for you, sir.
Sir, they're still debating the route.
Pakistani general says since we didn't deign to inform him of the raid, it's gonna take some time to mobilize the 10th Mountain and a hundred vehicles.
I understand, but it is my duty to remind him...
that my men are surrounded by thousands of armed Somali militia.
It is imperative that we move them out of the hostile area...
You are the Ranger who kills my people?
None of you Americans smoke anymore.
You all live long, dull, uninteresting lives.
What do you want with me?
My government will never negotiate for me.
Then perhaps you and I can negotiate, huh?
Do you really think if you get General Aidid, we will simply put down our weapons...
There will always be killing, you see?
This is how things are in our world.
Mike Durant, we won't leave you behind.
Mike Durant, we won't leave you behind.
You got to take over for me.
It's the femoral artery, but I can't see it, which means that it's retracted up into the pelvis, which means that I have to find it and clamp it.
It's the only way to stop the bleeding.
I got no more I.V.'s, so...
I'm gonna need you to assist, okay?
I gotta cause you more pain, but I have to do it to help you, you understand?
It'll lower your heart rate too far. I'm sorry.
Twombly, why don't you take his hands there.
Yurek, you're gonna take the feet and a flashlight.
I got it. I got it.
What the hell are you doing?
It's all in the grind, Sarge.
Sarge, how'd you like a nice hot cup of joe?
Let me take a look at that foot.
Where the hell did they find you?
I need some coverin' fire. Over.
Ground personnel will have to mark target positions with infrared strobes.
Get Little Birds on strafing runs and keep 'em going all night long.
If we don't hold back this city, we're gonna have a hundred caskets to fill by morning.
Colonel Harrell, ground personnel at crash site one...
will have to mark the target with infrared strobes in preparation for air strike.
Between the 10th Mountain and U.N., we got enough personnel, okay?
Danny, you guys do not have to go back out again.
You're not gonna die, all right?
You don't have anything to be sorry for.
You did what you were trained to do.
You should be proud of that.
You tell my parents that I fought well today.
And that I-- that I-- that I fought hard.
You're gonna tell them yourself, okay?
You just gotta hang in there a little bit.
You did all you could here.
Right now we'd be out there defending another crashed chopper.
More men would get torn up.
'Cause, Sergeant, you can't control who gets hit or who doesn't, who falls out of a chopper or why.
Blackburn wouldn't have fallen, none of this would've happened.
Should have or could have, it don't matter.
You'll get plenty of time to think about all that later.
Sergeant, you got your men this far.
You need to start thinking about getting these men out of here.
I need four guns in this corner now!
This is Barber 5-2 in position for gun run.
This is 2-5! I can see you.
I'm putting it on the roof.
Okay, guys, we're gonna lay down some cover fire for him!
I thought I heard a noise out here!
2-5, this is 6-4. Rescue column has arrived. We'll be at your location in about 5 minutes.
I heard you guys needed a lift!
I got you, I got you.
We get the pilots' bodies out, then we go to the stadium.
We're running out of room around here.
Just gonna have to cram into every possible space.
Okay, 10th Mountain provides security for armor, walks us out of the hot zone.
We'll walk you out of the hot zone, then jump on the last few vehicles.
Okay, let's get out of here.
These things are fucking bullet magnets.
We go when I'm ordered to, Soldier!
Colonel, what is going on down there?
They're dismantling the entire cockpit around the body.
- Do what you have to do.
I'm not getting on no fucking roof!
Bullet missed your jugular by about three millimeters.
Little short on coffee, but I got you some tea.
It went in and out, so the medic said I should be okay, a couple of days.
You bet your ass we will.
Don't go back out there without me.
I can still do my job.
You get some rest now, okay?
When I go home, people ask me, Hey, Hoot, why do you do it, man?
Why? You some kind of war junkie?
I won't say a goddamn word.
They won't understand why we do it.
They won't understand it's about the men next to you.
Hey, don't even think about it, all right?
Hey, we started a whole new week.
I was talking to Blackburn the other day and he asked me, What changed?
But that's not true, you know.
A friend of mine asked me before I got here-- So we were all shipping out.
He asked me, Why are you going to fight somebody else's war?
What do y'all think, you're heroes?
I didn't know what to say at the time, but...
if he asked me again, I'd say no.
I'd say there's no way in hell.
Nobody asks to be a hero.
It just sometimes turns out that way.
I'll talk to your ma and pa when I get home, okay?
My love, you're strong and you'll do well in life.
I love you and my children deeply.
Today and tomorrow, let each day grow and grow.
Keep smiling and never give up, even when things get you down.
So, in closing, my love, tonight, tuck my children in bed warmly.
Tell them I love them, then hug them for me and give them both a kiss good night for Daddy..
